item.title: Guillermo add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "<b>Faith, n.</b> Belief without evidence in what is told by one who speaks without knowledge, of things without parallel." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Guillermo add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "<b>Pray, v.</b> To ask that the laws of the universe be annulled in behalf of a single petitioner, confessedly unworthy." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Guillermo add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "That which can be asserted without evidence, can be dismissed without evidence." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Guillermo add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "Everybody does have a book in them, but in most cases that's where it should stay." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Guillermo add a quote by Hubert Selby Jr.
item.description: "...and the night was comfortably warm as the soft filtered light continued to push the darkness into the shadows as they held each other and kissed and pushed each others darkness into the corner, believing in each others light, each others dream." -- Hubert Selby Jr.

item.title: Guillermo add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Guillermo add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Guillermo add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Guillermo add a quote by Ken Kesey
item.description: "Man, when you lose your laugh you lose your footing." -- Ken Kesey

item.title: Guillermo add a quote by D.H. Lawrence
item.description: "A woman has to live her life, or live to repent not having lived it." -- D.H. Lawrence

item.title: Guillermo add a quote by Kate Chopin
item.description: "Perhaps it is better to wake up after all, even to suffer, rather than to remain a dupe to illusions all one's life." -- Kate Chopin

item.title: Guillermo add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Let us read, and let us dance; these two amusements will never do any harm to the world." -- Voltaire

item.title: Guillermo add a quote by Walter Cronkite
item.description: "Whatever the cost of our libraries, the price is cheap compared to that of an ignorant nation." -- Walter Cronkite

item.title: Guillermo add a quote by Walter Cronkite
item.description: "America's health care system is neither healthy, caring, nor a system." -- Walter Cronkite

item.title: Guillermo add a quote by Walter Cronkite
item.description:
"I think being a liberal, in the true sense, is being nondoctrinaire, nondogmatic, non-committed to a cause - but examining each case on its merits. Being left of center is another thing; it's a political position. I think most newspapermen by definition have to be liberal; if they're not liberal, by my definition of it, then they can hardly be good newspapermen. If they're preordained dogmatists for a cause, then they can't be very good journalists; that is, if they carry it into their journalism."
[Interview with Ron Powers (<i>Chicago Sun Times</i>) for <i>Playboy</i>, 1973]" -- Walter Cronkite

item.title: Guillermo add a quote by Louise Erdrich
item.description: "We do know that no one gets wise enough to really understand the heart of another, though it is the task of our life to try." -- Louise Erdrich

item.title: Guillermo add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Guillermo add a quote by Jimi Hendrix
item.description: "I'm the one that's got to die when it's time for me to die, so let me live my life the way I want to." -- Jimi Hendrix

item.title: Guillermo add a quote by Charles Baudelaire
item.description: "Genius is nothing more nor less than childhood recaptured at will." -- Charles Baudelaire

item.title: Guillermo add a quote by Edgar Degas
item.description: "I want to be famous but unknown!" -- Edgar Degas

item.title: Guillermo add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I have never listened to anyone who criticized my taste in space travel, sideshows or gorillas. When this occurs, I pack up my dinosaurs and leave the room." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Guillermo add a quote by Ogden Nash
item.description: "Tonight’s December thirty-first, Something is about to burst. The clock is crouching, dark and small, Like a time bomb in the hall. Hark, it's midnight, children dear. Duck! Here comes another year!" -- Ogden Nash

item.title: Guillermo add a quote by Charlie Chaplin
item.description: "I always like walking in the rain, so no one can see me crying." -- Charlie Chaplin

item.title: Guillermo add a quote by T.E. Lawrence
item.description: "All men dream: but not equally. Those who dream by night in the dusty recesses of their minds wake up in the day to find it was vanity, but the dreamers of the day are dangerous men, for they may act their dreams with open eyes, to make it possible." -- T.E. Lawrence
